By: Hannah Ritchie First published in February 2024. Last updated in May 2025. Cite this article Reuse our work freely Electric vehicles are an essential solution to decarbonizing transport. Electric cars tend to have a lower carbon footprint than petrol or diesel cars over their lifetimes. While more carbon is emitted in the manufacturing stage, this carbon debt tends to pay off quickly once theyre on the road. 1 The carbon savings are higher in countries with a cleaner electricity mix , and these savings will also increase as countries continue to decarbonize their electricity grids. How quickly are countries moving to electrified transport? Which countries are leading the way? In this article, we look at data from across the world on electric vehicle (EV) sales and the stock on the road. This data comes from the International Energy Agency . It publishes its Global EV Outlook every year. We will update this data every time a new release is published. 2 Sales of new cars What share of new cars are electric? Sales of electric cars started from a low base but are growing quickly in many markets. Globally, over 1-in-5 (22%) of new cars sold were electric in 2024. This share was 92% in Norway, and in China, it was almost 50%. In the chart below, you can explore these trends across the world. Here, electric cars include fully battery-electric vehicles and plug-in hybrids . Fully-electric cars vs. plug-in hybrids Electric cars include battery-electric and plug-in hybrid vehicles. The difference is that fully battery-electric cars do not have an internal combustion engine. In contrast, plug-in hybrids have a rechargeable battery and electric motor, and an internal combustion engine that runs on gasoline. That means a plug-in hybrid could be driven as a standard petrol car if the owner did not charge the battery. The battery in plug-in hybrids is smaller and has a shorter range than battery-electric cars, so over longer distances, the car starts running on gasoline once the battery has run out. Since plug-in hybrids will often run on petrol, they tend to emit more carbon than battery-electric cars. However, they do usually have lower emissions than petrol or diesel cars. 3 In the first chart below you can see electric car sales broken down by these two technologies. This is given as a share of new cars sold each year. In the second, you will find the share of new electric cars sold that are fully battery-electric . How many new electric cars are sold each year? The chart below shows the total number of new electric cars sold. Again, this includes fully battery-electric and plug-in hybrids . Clicking on any country will show how sales have changed over time. How many new internal combustion engine cars and electric cars are sold each year? Based on the data published by the IEA on the number of electric cars sold, and EV sales as a share of all new cars, we can calculate the absolute number of new cars of each type sold each year. These figures suggest that global sales of non-electric cars peaked in 2018. This aligns with other estimates published elsewhere; for example, Bloomberg New Energy Finance reported that sales peaked in 2017. You can explore this data for other countries in the chart below, too. Stocks of cars in use What share of cars on the road are electric? The cars that are on the road today represent sales data over more than a decade. This can be captured in a metric called stocks. Its an approximation of the number of cars that are in use and represents the balance of cars being added and those that are being retired. Because people use their cars for a long time, it takes time before new sales have a visible influence on car stocks. nodes.description: Gather data on current electric vehicle market size and growth rate.
nodes.agent_prompt: Collect data on the current global and regional electric vehicle market size, including sales volume and revenue. Also, find projections for the growth rate of the EV market over the next 5-10 years. Focus on reputable sources such as market research reports, industry publications, and government statistics.

nodes.description: Gather data on key electric vehicle market trends, including consumer preferences and government incentives.
nodes.agent_prompt: Identify and gather information on key trends shaping the electric vehicle market, such as changing consumer preferences, technological advancements, government incentives and regulations, and charging infrastructure development. Collect data from consumer surveys, industry reports, and policy documents.

nodes.description: Gather data on major players in the electric vehicle market, including their market share and strategies.
nodes.agent_prompt: Research and gather information on the major companies in the electric vehicle market, including Tesla, BYD, Volkswagen, and other significant players. Collect data on their market share, sales performance, product portfolios, and strategic initiatives. Use company reports, news articles, and market analysis reports.

nodes.description: Gather data on technological advancements in electric vehicles, including battery technology and charging infrastructure.
nodes.agent_prompt: Collect data on the latest technological advancements in electric vehicles, with a focus on battery technology (e.g., solid-state batteries, improved energy density) and charging infrastructure (e.g., fast charging, wireless charging). Use research papers, technology news articles, and industry reports.

nodes.description: Analyze the collected data to identify key trends in the electric vehicle market.
nodes.agent_prompt: Analyze the data gathered from T001, T002, T003, and T004 to identify key trends in the electric vehicle market. These trends may include changes in consumer behavior, emerging technologies, shifts in market share, and the impact of government policies. Focus on extracting actionable insights and summarizing the implications of each trend.

nodes.description: Develop visualizations to illustrate the key trends in the electric vehicle market.
nodes.agent_prompt:
Based on the analysis in T005, generate the following visualizations using Python and libraries like Matplotlib, Seaborn, or Plotly. Ensure that the visualizations are clear, concise, and visually appealing. Create placeholder for future updates.

1.  Line chart showing the growth of the EV market size over the past 5 years and projected growth for the next 5 years. Label axes clearly.
2.  Bar chart comparing the market share of major EV players.
3.  Pie chart illustrating the distribution of EV sales by region (e.g., North America, Europe, Asia Pacific).
4.  Scatter plot showing the relationship between battery capacity and driving range for different EV models.

Output both code and output in JSON format.

nodes.description: Create a comprehensive analysis report summarizing the key findings and trends in the electric vehicle market, incorporating the visualizations.
nodes.agent_prompt: Based on the analysis from T005 and the visualizations from T006, create a detailed analysis report summarizing the key findings and trends in the electric vehicle market. The report should include an introduction, a section on market size and growth, a section on key market trends, a section on major players, a section on technological advancements, and a conclusion. Incorporate the visualizations generated in T006 to illustrate the key points. Use clear and concise language and format the report for readability and visual appeal. The report should be structured into sections with appropriate headings and subheadings. Format final report in markdown. Be exhaustive and comprehensive.
